DOCNAME: OBCIANSKE ZDRUZENIE ZI A NECHAJ ZIT v. SLOVAKIA
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , ORG združenie Ži a nechaj žiť ( Civic Association Live and Let Live ) , is an association with its seat in GPE . The application on its behalf was submitted by its President , Ms NORP ORG . The applicant association was represented by PERSON P. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant association organised a cycle - ride event in the course of which a road crossing was blocked in GPE with a view to pointing out the difficulties encountered by cyclists in the streets of the capital .

On DATE the Mayor of Bratislava imposed on the applicant association a fine of CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) , which was then the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) , for using roads in an unauthorised manner .
The applicant association appealed .
On DATE the Bratislava ORG upheld the Mayor 's decision .
On DATE ORG in GPE dismissed the applicant association 's motion against the above administrative decisions .

On DATE the applicant association lodged a complaint with ORG alleging a violation of LAW and of its constitutional equivalent . The applicant association claimed , inter alia , SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL as just satisfaction for non - pecuniary damage . Its representative stated that the fine imposed exceeded the financial means of the association , that its representatives had been exposed to considerable pressure and that enforcement proceedings had been brought , the costs of which exceeded SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL . As a result , the association had difficulties in obtaining grants and had been restricted in carrying out its activities .
At the request of the Mayor of GPE of DATE the Bratislava ORG discontinued the enforcement proceedings on CARDINAL DATE . It held that no fees were payable to the enforcement officer .

On DATE ORG concluded that the applicant association 's right under LAW had been violated . It quashed ORG judgment and returned the case to ORG . It ordered the latter to reimburse the applicant association 's costs incurred in the constitutional proceedings and held that the above finding of a breach of the applicant association '
On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision as being unlawful with reference to the finding of ORG . It ordered the administrative authority to reimburse the costs which the applicant had incurred .
On DATE ORG reimbursed the relevant sum to the applicant association . On DATE it returned the file to the Mayor of GPE .
By a decision of CARDINAL DATE the Mayor of GPE discontinued the proceedings in which the above fine had been imposed on the applicant association .
Until DATE the sphere of ORG liability for damage caused by wrong decisions and official misconduct was regulated by LAW of DATE ( Law no . PERSON . ) .

In accordance with the courts ' practice , LAW of DATE did not allow for compensation to be awarded for damage of a nonpecuniary nature . The only exception to this rule was compensation for damage to health .
With effect from DATE Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . was enacted , replacing LAW of DATE .
Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(a ) , the ORG is liable for damage caused by an unlawful decision .
Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides for compensation for pecuniary damage including loss of profit and , where appropriate , compensation for damage of a non - pecuniary nature .
Pursuant to section DATE , the provisions of PERSON no . CARDINAL apply only to damage caused by decisions which were given after its entry into force .
